post.description: Triggers reading data from a SaaS instance. See [Trigger a read](https://docs.withampersand.com/define-integrations/read-actions#trigger-a-read) for details.

groupRef.description: The ID of the user group whose SaaS instance you'd like to read data from. This is the ID that was provided during installation creation.

mode.description: The mode of read operation. Currently only asynchronus operation is supported.

sinceTimestamp.description: The UTC timestamp from which to read data. If omitted, we will read all data.

untilTimestamp.description: The UTC timestamp until which to read data.

400.description: The failure response for bad request.

allOf.title: Problem
allOf.description:
A Problem Details object (RFC 9457).

Additional properties specific to the problem type may be present.

type.description: An absolute URI that identifies the problem type

href.description: An absolute URI that, when dereferenced, provides human-readable documentation for the problem type (e.g. using HTML).

title.description: A short summary of the problem type. Written in English and readable for engineers (usually not suited for non technical stakeholders and not localized).

status.description: The HTTP status code generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

instance.description: An absolute URI that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

example.title: Description of the type of problem that occurred
example.detail: Description of specific occurrence of the problem

subsystem.description: The subsystem that generated the problem

time.description: The time the problem occurred, formatted as RFC-3339

requestId.description: A unique identifier for the request, useful for debugging

items.description: A brief description of something which caused the problem

causes.description:
A list of problems that caused this problem. This can be used to represent multiple
root causes. There is no guaranteed ordering of the causes.

remedy.description: A brief description of how to resolve the problem
remedy.example: Shorten your input to be under 100 characters

supportEmail.description: An email address to contact for support

supportPhone.description: A phone number to contact for support

supportUrl.description: A URL to contact for support

retryable.description: Whether the request can be retried

retryAfter.description: A timestamp after which the request can be retried, formatted as RFC-3339

post.description: If a read action has delivery mode set to onRequest, then use this endpoint to request for more results. Learn more in [Delivery modes](https://docs.withampersand.com/define-integrations/read-actions#delivery-modes).

groupRef.description: The ID of the user group whose SaaS instance you'd like to receive results from. This is the ID that was provided during installation creation.

pages.description: The number of pages you are ready to receive from the group's SaaS instance.

400.description: The failure response for bad request.

post.description: Pauses all reads for an installation. If reads are already paused, this will be a no-op. Accepts specific objects to pause reads for in the request body.

parameters.name: projectIdOrName
parameters.description: The Ampersand project ID or project name.

items.description: The names of the objects (mapped or unmapped) to pause reads for. If not provided, all objects will be paused.

note.description: A note to accompany the pause.

post.description: Unpauses all reads for an installation. If no reads were paused, this will be a no-op. Accepts specific objects to unpause reads for in the request body.

parameters.name: projectIdOrName
parameters.description: The Ampersand project ID or project name.

items.description: The names of the objects to unpause reads for.

note.description: A note to accompany the unpause.
